title: Make-up offering later in the week
vignette: Someone missed bringing the required holiday offering on day 1. May it be brought on any later day of the festival, or is day 1 exclusive?

options.text: Yes, bring it any day of the festival.
No; it must be on day one only.

title: Using dedicated food funds for an offering
vignette: A visitor wants to pay for the holiday sacrifice with money that was originally set aside for festival meals. Is repurposing those funds allowed?

options.text: Permitted; it's still holy use.
Not allowed; maaser sheni must be eaten, not sacrificed.

title: Pilgrims exempt from appearing
vignette: Someone is lame in one foot but can hobble to designated zone. Is he required to make the pilgrimage?

options.text: Yes if he can manage the trip.
He is exempt due to difficulty.

title: Discussing advanced mystical topics
vignette: Students want to dive into complex metaphysical subjects during holiday gatherings. Their mentor is hesitant. Should such study be encouraged for capable learners, or postponed?

options.text: Allow if they are mature and prepared.
Discourage; such study is restricted.

title: Entering sacred courtyard while impure
vignette: A participant who had recent contact with a corpse cannot complete purification before the festival. May they enter the central courtyard to observe, or must they stay outside?

options.text: No entry; impurity bars him.
Allow entry to watch from a distance.

title: Excessive rejoicing
vignette: Some groups dance wildly in the central complex courtyard, bordering on disrespect. Should officials intervene?

options.text: Let the joy continue; it's the festival spirit.
Restrain them to maintain reverence.

title: Teaching deep secrets to an eager youth
vignette: A talented but immature teenager begs to study advanced doctrines. Should the teacher begin gradual instruction, or insist the student wait until older?

options.text: Teach him gradually despite concerns.
Decline until he matures more.

title: Shortage of knives for festival slaughter
vignette: Pilgrims arrive but there aren't enough ritual knives. Should offerings wait until proper tools are sourced, or may they improvise with available implements?

options.text: Wait until utensils are available.
Use whatever tools they have.

title: Charity instead of pilgrimage
vignette: A poor family cannot afford travel to designated zone. They propose donating the cost to charity instead.

options.text: Charity can replace the pilgrimage this year.
They must still attempt the journey.

title: Bringing infants to the assembly
vignette: Parents wonder if they must bring their baby to the gathering area or if attendance applies only to adults. What's required?

options.text: Bring the child to introduce them early.
Leave infants home; only adults are obligated.

title: Borrowing an animal for the offering
vignette: Someone without livestock asks to borrow a friend's animal for the festival sacrifice. Is that acceptable, or must one use personal property?

options.text: Borrowing is fine if repaid later.
Each must offer his own property.

title: Sacrifice from stolen funds
vignette: An individual regretfully admits that his festival offering money came from dishonest business. Should he proceed?

options.text: Use the money anyway and repent later.
Do not bring a sacrifice from stolen funds.

title: Substituting cash when animal prices surge
vignette: Animal prices skyrocket near the pilgrimage site. Can worshipers give money to the sanctuary instead of purchasing overpriced animals?

options.text: Yes; money offerings are acceptable in a pinch.
No; animals are required despite the cost.

title: Fasting for penitence during a celebratory week
vignette: A group feels remorseful and wants to observe a private fast on a festival day. Is fasting compatible with the holiday's mood of joy?

options.text: Fasting is inappropriate; eat and rejoice.
Allow a private fast if heartfelt.

title: Staying overnight in designated zone
vignette: After bringing the offerings, may pilgrims return home the same day or must they sleep in the city?

options.text: They must stay overnight at least once.
They may depart immediately if desired.
